items: Place a weight plate on a weightlifting belt and secure it around your waist.
Stand facing a sturdy object, such as a squat rack or wall, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Place the balls of your feet on a raised surface, such as a step or block, with your heels hanging off the edge.
Keeping your legs straight, lift your heels as high as possible while contracting your calf muscles.
Lower your heels back down to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your calves.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
After completing the set, switch the weight plate to the other side of your waist and repeat the exercise.
Targets the calf muscles specifically, helping to build strength and size in this area
Can be done with weights to increase resistance and challenge the muscles even more
Helps to improve ankle stability and balance
Can be done at home or in the gym with minimal equipment
Can be modified for different fitness levels by adjusting the weight or number of reps
